result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey James Hejdak

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak not in court, in custody.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Jeffrey James Hejdak.  Defendant's appearance waived. Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defendant has two other cases 22CF485, 22CM311 and 22CM312. Defense requested plea and sentencing date; possible global resolution. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak not in court, in custody.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Jeffrey James Hejdak.  Prosecuting attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defendant has other pending matters and is pursuing treatment court. Branch 36 will accept other matters for resolution. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court, defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak not in court, in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court, defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for bail/bond hearing. Bail motion by Defense argued and DENIED by the Court. All conditions remain the same. Defense request a hearing. Case adjourned, Branch 38. **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak in court with attorney Colin Mcginn appear for Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Marquette Officer Q.Harris.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38. Defense wants to be heard on bail.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Walgreens - 1600 West Wisconsin Avenue

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeffrey James Hejdak appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
